After a model with the Mob trait performs a Morale test, all remaining Attentive Friendly Mob models within Cohesion apply the same results of that Test. A Mob character may never be Designated Leader for Initiative Tests or Bottle Tests unless there are no non-Mob models remaining. A Mob model may |Start Group| for zero cost, or join a Group Action for zero cost if all Group Members have the Mob trait and are within half of Cohesion of either the Group Leader or two other Members. At the start of its Initiative, a Mob model must move to within Cohesion of the nearest Friendly Mob model within Visibility. If no such model exists, use the Biased Scatter diagram with the desired direction.

Modern X.description: Ignore first X |Jammed!| ROF dice. May use an additional X ROF before requiring an extra AP. If Modern+ also ignore first X potential Out-of-Ammo dice.

Modern+ X.description: Ignore first X |Jammed!| ROF dice. May use an additional X ROF before requiring an extra AP. If Modern+ also ignore first X potential Out-of-Ammo dice.

Multi-form X > List.description: This character has X additional models associated as itemized in list List, and each has a different Archetype with the Sub-form trait. Only one model may be used at any given time and it will take X + 3 AP to switch them out. If the character can spend or receive Mana, each spent will reduce the amount of AP required by 1 to a minimum of 1 AP. After becoming KO'd or Eliminated, this character returns to the model associated with this archetype and trait.

Multi-headed X > List.description: Genetic. This character has X additional heads. These provide +X Modifier dice for Detect, Disengage, and Close Combat Hit Tests. Each time becomes Eliminated by a Cleave or KO’d by Stun damage, reduce X by one. If at least one level re-mains, this model does not become KO’d or Eliminated. For tests involving Blinding or Stun against this model, receive a bonus of +X Modifier dice.

Multi-strike X.description: Intrinsic. Receive X Strike points to divide between and attack additional targets for Close Combat. Perform a single Attacker Close Combat Hit Test. For each Strike point assigned to a target, add a Wild die to the Attacker’s roll just for that target. If every attack fails, one of the targets if qualified may perform Counter-strike.

Multi-target X.description: Intrinsic. Perform the same Range Attack again but against another target within Cohesion of the LOF to the last. Do this X times.

Nanoweave.description: Asset. Suit. Negates one level of Cleave when targeted. Reduce [Laden] by 2. (Should be Laden -2)

Night-vision X.description: Intrinsic. If Lighting OR is more than zero, increase Visibility OR by +X MU.

Nimble X.description: Genetic. Skill. Attentive characters may spend Agility from MOV up to X additional times during an Action. Must consecutively jump and climb between Walls or Obstacles with each use of Agility. The last AP spent must cause the model to finish at a level position on the battlefield. Obstacles may include Distracted Opposing models which have lower REF and are SIZ + 3 or larger. If X is 2, 3, or 4; instead allow SIZ + 2, SIZ + 1, or SIZ or larger.

Nocturnal.description: Visibility is always 8 MU regardless of Lighting if it is at least 1 MU. Receive +1 Wild dice for Detect Test if target within 4 MU.

Obscuring X.description: AoE. Creates Obscuring terrain within 2 MU of any Gas marker associated with this attack.

Obviate X.description: Qualifies to perform an Obviate Attack for 1 AP if Attentive Free and within Cohesion of a primary Opposing character which itself is within Cohesion of a second target and within LOS of this character. Perform the Obviate Attack as a +X Modifier Opposed INT Test. The primary character receives delay X Delay tokens equal to cascades. The primary character may remove one of those tokens for every 1 MU if it repositions in a straight line towards the second target until it is in base-contact with it. If the character performing the Obviate attack is Distracted, the primary character is presumed to have properly performed the Disengage action if it decides to reposition.

Officer X > Designation.description: Intrinsic. This character is an Officer Rank of X. When Designated Leader, receives +X Go Points When Group Leader, allow one additional Group Follower each unique Officer Rank in the Group. While Attentive, provides +1 Modifier dice for Morale Tests to Friendly characters of lower Officer Rank (if any). If there are multiple non-KO’d Friendly Officer characters of the same Faction on the battlefield within Visibility or Cohesion of each other, the one with the highest Rank must become Designated Leader unless it is Distracted.

Optics X.description: Asset. While using the Concentrate action and the range to target is at least 8 MU, the Optics OR is double the higher of Visibility OR or the Ranged weapon OR before modifications from any other traits. For every X above one, double the Optics OR. All targets within within LOS and Optics OR are regarded as Revealed, but they keep their Hidden status for other models until Detected.

Outwit X.description: If Attentive and the target is Distracted; may use INT for Hit Tests, Disengage Tests, and Detect Tests and with +X Modifier dice. Reduces Opposing Outwit X.

Overload X.description: Asset. Attack Effect. Prior to performing a Test using this Item, an Attentive Ordered Active character may choose to overload up to X Battery points and make them become +1 instead. Resolve an Overload Test as an Unopposed Test at DR 1 per Battery point used. If no successes were scored on any two of the Base dice, note which dice are misses. Identify this weapon with an |Jammed!| status marker for each. The weapon is not available again for use until these are cleared via a Fiddle action for 1 AP.

Pack Mentality.description: Genetic. Psychology. Mind. Having 1, 2, 5, or 10 Friendly models within Cohesion with Pack-mentality provides +1, 2, 3, or 4 Modifier dice for all Morale Tests. All Friendly Ready Ordered models with the Pack-mentality trait within Cohesion of a Group Member qualify to become Group Members. Start a Group Action for no cost if all Group Followers have Pack-mentality. Increase the number of allowed Group Followers by 1, at zero cost to join a Group.

Parry X.description: Receive +1 Modifier die for Defender Close Combat Tests

Pathfinder X.description: See Surefooted. Whenever this character is Group Leader of a Group Move and moves first; all Followers which do not have the Surefooted trait are treated as though they have Surefooted at level 1 .

Perimeter.description: While Attentive, Opposing models may only make base-contact if they are Attentive and use Agility. Receives +1 Modifier die Defending Close Combat while not in base-contact or when Opposing model moves into base-contact for the current Initiative.

Pierce X.description: Ignores Bulletproof trait unless it is paired with Hardened. Reduces the Hardened trait of the target in an attack by an equal amount, up to X levels. If there is remaining Pierce, some X amount; this causes X + 1 Impact, and X +1 Damage.

Pilot X.description: Presume this model's CCA, RCA, and REF have been increased by X while it has entered a model with the Cockpit trait.

Pin-point X.description: While Attentive receive +X Impact for all attacks. Reduce target FOR by X for every Impact remaining after reducing any Armor Rating from Armor traits. If this trait is tied to an item, then the bonus for that trait is for the common use of that item. Use the lowest amount of Impact remaining for Defender if it had multiple types of Armor.

Pipes of Madness X.description: Costs 2 AP. All targets within 12X MU subject to Fear X. Within 6X MU as Fear 2X. Within 3X MU as Fear 3X.

Planning X.description: If this character has been designated Leader and begins the current Turn as Ordered, the owner may spend Initiative Points to receive +1 Modifier die each on Test unrelated to attacking or defending in combat.

Poison X.description: Attack Effect. Bio-agent. After passing the Combat Test, if the target has effectively zero Armor Rating, assign the target one Poisoned token per FOR cascades spent, but at least 1 cascade. Receive X cascades for this purpose. Allow this assignment once per Action. The effects of being Poisoned do not trigger until the start of the target’s next Initiative. If the target has a Natural Weapon which has the Poison trait, then reduce X by the lower of both.

Poisoner X.description: Skill. See Resist X > Poison. All Natural, Bow, Melee, or Thrown weapons starting the Mission assigned to this character receive Poison X trait. Identify up to X Bow, Melee, or Thrown weapons assigned to Friendly characters as having the Poison trait at X minus 1, to a minimum of 1.

Porter X.description: Skill. Receive +X Physicality specifically for Carrying. Reduces [Overlooked] and [Breakable] each by X.

Pounce.description: Natural Weapon. Use Agility at the end of a Move action to make base-contact with one Opposing model. The target model and all Opposing models within Melee Range that are SIZ + 3 or less must either reposition backwards a base-diameter or acquire a Delay token. Reposition the Active model into base-contact with any of the Opposing models which either repositioned or that acquired a Delay token. Receive +1 Modifier die Attacker Close Combat Hit Test if Hidden just prior this Attack. When combined with the Optional Rule for Dislodging Charge, receive +1 Dislodge value for every 1 MU of Agility used for target. (¤)

Precise.description: Receive +1 Modifier die carryover per 2 cascades from the Attacker Hit Test for the Attacker Damage Test.

Predict X.description: While Attentive and unless the Opposing characters have equal or higher Predict; this character receives +X REF. Hidden targets behind Cover within Visibility with less REF behave as Revealed just for this character but do not reposition. In addition, they do not receive Intervening Cover benefit.

Presence X.description: Costs 1 AP. If no character has yet been Wounded; perform Opposed INT vs. POW Test +X Modifier dice against Sociable target within Cohesion. Receive +1 Modifier die for every Attentive Friendly model within Cohesion that also has Presence. Upon pass this model and any Friendly models within Cohesion may not be targeted by Combat attacks until after the target itself has been attacked. If targeted, reduces other’s Presence by X.

Projection X.description: If Attentive, just prior to becoming Engaged, reposition this model X × 1 MU and acquire a Delay token.

Protective X.description: Intrinsic. Discard X Delay tokens received as Stun damage. Must be in Cover if targeted by a Concentrated Range Combat attack. Must be Attentive if targeted by a Concentrated Close Combat Attack.

Psi-Armor X.description: Psychic. Receives +X Modifier dice for Attacker Damage Test against Psychic Attacks.

Psi-Boost X.description: Psychology. see [Noise]. At the start of Initiative, discard all Boost tokens, and then if Free Ordered Attentive, acquire X Boost tokens. Whenever Attentive, any Friendly model within Cohesion may be issued a bonus +1 Modifier die for any Test by discarding an Boost token. If there is a target for the Test, this character must have LOS to the target before issuing the bonus. Does not work with Radio. No character may benefit from Boost more than once per Test. Acquire a Delay token to remove [Noise].

Psi-Dampener X.description: Psychic. Reduces any Opposing Psychic trait by X if target with the trait or beneficiiary of that target with the trait is within Psi-Dampener OR. Psi-Dampener OR is INT + POW. Reduce X each Psi-Dampener ORM.

Psi-Link X.description: Psychic. Receives +X Modifier dice for Attacker Hit Test, which is performed using Opposed INT vs. INT. Ignores all target Deflect traits.

Psionic.description: See Psychic. Any Armor, Equipment, or Tool may be prefixed with this classifier as part of its name and will function as though the character has that item.

Psi-Shield X.description: Psychic. Receives +X Modifier dice for Defender Hit Test versus Magic Attacks.

Psi-Tensor.description: Psychic. Tensor OR is POW x 1 MU. While Attentive Ordered, or if the target is Distracted or Disordered, acquire a Delay token to reduce all of the target's Attribute rating by X if they are within Tensor OR. Effectively reduce X by 1 per Tensor ORM. If multiple characters have Psi-tensor within range of each other, use the highest effective Friendly level and the highest effective Opposing level, and then reduce each by the smaller amount.

Psi-Weave X.description: Psychic. Receives +X Modifier dice for Attacker Damage Test, which is performed using Opposed INT vs. POW. Ignores all target Armor traits if target is Distracted or is within Visibility.

Pummel X.description: Skill. Natural Weapon. See [2H]. This trait may be used to attack as though it were a Natural weapon, and counts as having used 2 Hands. When used for Attacking receive +X Modifier dice for the Attacker Close Combat Tests. Receive +X Impact if Attentive. Penalized -1 Modifier die Defender Close Combat Tests unless equipped with another Melee weapon. Receive +1 Stun trait if the Opposing model is within 1 SIZ of this model.

Quick X.description: Receives +X REF if in Wait status. Receive +X Wild die Attacker Close Combat Hit Test if target is Distracted.

Quills X.description: See [Stub], [Awkward]. This trait may be used to perform +X Modifier dice Range Combat Hit Test against up to X targets using OR of X MU. For every target above the first, penalize -Base die Range Attacker Hit Test. Receive Impact +X. Causes X Damage as Stun damage. Penalize -1 Damage per OR multiple for Damage Tests. When Attentive or when using Concentrate, disregard penalty for Range Combat Hit Test.

Radio X.description: Any two Friendly models with Radio benefit as follows; Attentive Ordered models checking Situational Awareness are always within LOS. Distance can be disregarded. Attentive Ordered models are always within Cohesion. This may be waived by the Player. Cohesion between the two models otherwise has an OR of both Radio levels added together, times the Visibility OR. This may be waived by the Player. When using Radio to establish Cohesion for Morale Tests, limit any bonus dice received for that to just one.

Radio X > Target.description: see Radio X. Any targets which have the keyword Keyword are regarded as having at least Radio zero, limiting it to zero Cohesion and no Situational Awareness when Active; providing benefit only as targets.

Reach X.description: Intrinsic. The Melee Range of this character is extended up to X × 1 MU further than the default, which is typically measured from its base. When Attentive Ordered, the Melee Range may extend through the base of a Friendly Attentive Ordered model, or a Distracted or Disordered Opposing model.

Regenerate X.description: Magic. This character benefits from Regenerate as follows: Is never considered Eliminated, merely KO’d unless the source of Damage is one of; Acid-burned or Burned. At the start of its Initiative, remove X Hindrance tokens of any type. Receives +X Modifier dice for the Revive or the Recover action for itself.

Relay.description: Asset. When within LOS of any two or more Friendly models or Items with Automaton, Controller, or Relay allow those to behave as though they have LOS to each other.

Reputation X.description: Intrinsic. Psychology. For every Reputation level higher than the target within Visibility and LOS, receive +1 Modifier die for all Opposed tests against that target. Reality Distortion Field — If that target could be affected adversely by several Opposing characters with Reputation, use only the highest difference in Reputation levels. If the target has one or more of these Outsider, Invader, Mythos, Fear, or Beast traits, then Reputation will not affect them unless also have those same traits. If Opposing models have the Reputation trait, reduce X by the lower rating experienced by either model. Embodiment Limit — A character is allowed at most 1 Virtuosity trait per Reputation level, and a maximum of Reputation X trait levels for any Virtuosity trait. LoA Limit — Allowed LoA is increased to the highest Reputation level of any Friendly character on the battlefield.

Research X.description: After the Setup Sequence has completed but in reversed Initiative order; determine total Research levels per side. In highest to lowest total order when using play-aides like the Tactics cards, Spell cards, Resource cards, etc; search through the decks and take that many cards.

Resist X > List.description: Intrinsic. Ignore X of each trait, keyword, or Terrain type in list List when targeted.

Ricochet X.description: Asset. Skill. When performing a Range Attack with this weapon against a target within LOS, the LOF may be deflected against a terrain element that is Wall, Obstacle, or Vehicle that is within LOS. This is the reflection area. Allow up to X deflections across different reflection areas to the target. For each one, increase Attack OR by one but receive no penalty for it. Each deflection must at a 90-degree angle or greater. Each reflection area must be something which could be considered Hard Cover, at least 1 MU in size, and must be within LOS to the Attacker and the target, or to the previous reflection area if more than one is used. If Attack has the [Scatter] trait, none of the above applies. Instead, optionally allow it to deflect up to X more times before stopping after using the Scatter diagram.

Rider X.description: Provides bonuses when handling Steeds. If there are more than one species of Steed available in the game (such as Dog or Equine) for which this character can Mount, this bonus must be specific to one species. Receives +X Modifier dice for Rider Tests, and a Steed’s Morale Tests while Mounted. Reduces an Attentive Free Steed’s effect Fear token amount by X while in base-contact when determining if it can be Mounted.

ROF X.description: Attack Effect. Receive X ROF markers to attack Opposing models or battlefield locations when performing Attacker Range Combat. Each additional time the Attacker uses ROF this Initiative, reduce X by 1. Place the ROF markers between targets within LOS. Each target that is in LOS and which has an ROF marker within 1 MU range is attacked with +1 Wild die, known as an ROF die, for the Attacker Hit Test for each marker. Resolve all Attacker Tests before resolving any Morale Tests. Afterwards, remove all ROF markers.

Scholar X.description: Leader. Skill. This character is worth X Resource Points if brought into the Mission and is not Eliminated. Requires Resource Cards; When this character acquires an Objective marker, draw X additional Resource cards. Keep one card and reshuffle the remainder. (²) Requires Agenda Cards; When assigning Agenda cards, qualify to receive an additional card. (²)

Sensors X.description: Intrinsic. Electronic. Has Sensor OR of X × 4 MU. Use X × 8 MU if a target uses traits or Items with Energy, Psychotronic, or MEMSic keywords. Use X × 2 MU if only Etheric keywords. All targets within Sensor ORM 3 regardless of terrain are always regarded as Revealed, but they keep their Hidden status for other models until Detected. If LOF to a target crosses Walls or other Obstacle terrain, increase effective distance to them by 1 MU per 1 MU of terrain crossed, rounding up to the nearest whole MU.

Sequester X.description: Skill. Virtuosity. When Attentive and targeted for a Detect or Range Attack while behind Cover, receive +1 for all Defender Tests.

Sharp-sighted X.description: Increase Visibility by X x 4 MU during Day, X x 2 MU during Twilight, and X x 1 MU during Night. This total may exceed 16 MU

Shielding.description: When targeted; reduces Drain X, Stun by X. Ignores 2X Impact from Energy weapons.

Shieldmaster X.description: In Close Combat, reduces any Opposing Impact by X. When Attentive and equipped with a Shield which has the Coverage trait spend X as follows; For each X spent, receive +1 Modifier die for either the Defender Hit Test or Defender Damage Test. Must announce how these are spent before any Tests. If the Shield has the Bash trait, the spends may be applied to the Attacker Hit and Attack Damage Tests. As desired, apply this rule for Friendly models in base-contact also in base-contact with the Opposing model.

Shock X.description: Attack Effect. Electric. Bio-neural. See Stun X. See Anti-electric X. Reduce target FOR by X for the remainder of this Initiative.

Shoot X.description: Skill. Reduces up to X penalty Modifier dice for Attacker Range Combat Hit Tests. Increase OR and the maximum OR Multiple by X.

Silent X.description: Attack Effect. If using the Punctuated Noise optional rules, reduce any Noise generated with this Item by 1.

SIZ X.description: Increases the model's SIZ while equipped with this Armor. Use a larger model to represent this new SIZ.

Slam X.description: Natural Weapon. See [Awkward], [Stub]. Receive +X Physicality and +X Modifier die when performing a Dislodging Charge. If the target also has Slam X and is Free or Attentive, reduce both an equal amount first. Receive the +1 Stun trait if the Opposing model is within 1 SIZ of this model.

Slippery X.description: Virtuosity. Skill. Receives +X REF when determining if become Engaged during Movement; must only stop if Opposing models have higher REF. Receives +X Base dice for Disengage Tests as the Active model.

Smash X.description: Natural Weapon. Psychology. Skill. While base-contact with the target of an Attacker Close Combat Damage Test which passes;  Perform the |Smash| Bonus Action instead of causing Damage normally. As a result, receive X additional cascades; for every 3 cascades spent target receives 1 Stun damage.

Sneaky X.description: At the end of this character's Initiative automatically become Hidden at no cost if behind Cover or when not in LOS. Receives +X Modifier dice when benefiting from Suddenness Situational Test Modifier.

Sniper X.description: When behind Cover: Receive +X Base dice Detect Test and Range Combat Hit Test. Receive +X MU when performing Bonus Action Reposition if Attacker Range Combat Hit Test passes, if remain behind Cover or repositions to out of LOS.

Sonics X.description: Attack Effect. AoE. Sonic Effect is X. Sonic OR is 4 MU. Check all models within 1 MU of the LOF towards the first target, and up to X ORM beyond. Reduce Sonic Effect by 1 per Sonic ORM to that target. If Sonic Effect is zero or more, place a Suppression marker in base-contact with the target and within LOS. If the Sonic Effect is at least 1, have the target perform an Unopposed REF Test, DR Sonic Effect. Upon fail, assign a Delay token as Stun damage and one more for every 3 misses.

Sorcerer X > Type.description: Genetic. Magic. Psychology. Skill. Spellcaster. At the start of each game receive as choices, X + INT Spells at random; repeats increase their trait level each time. Reselect the spell choice if it is higher than the Sorcerer level. Optionally assign the character one of the six Specialization. Either Combat, Eldritch, Knowledge, Dominance, Conjuration, or Transformation. See the Magic System rules for more information.

Soul Eater.description: If in base-contact with a recently Eliminated model, perform a Fiddle action and a Unopposed INT Test -3. For every success, view one card drawn at random belonging to the other player that hasn't yet been viewed; Tactics, Resource, Spell, Advantage, Objective. Allowed just once per KIA model.

Spike X.description: Genetic. Natural Weapon. See [Stub], [Awkward]. This trait may be used to perform -X Modifier dice Close Combat Hit Test. Causes X Modifier dice Damage at Impact X. Ignores target's Deflect by X.

Spit X > List.description: Genetic. Natural Weapon. Melee. See [Stub], [Awkward]. This trait may be used to perform +X Base dice Range Combat Hit Test against a target. Spit OR is STR + X MU. When Attentive or when using Concentrate, disregard penalty for Range Combat Hit Test. If Hit Test passes, apply any traits in list List.

Splash X > Trait.description: AoE. Attack Effect. Splash Radius is X MU. All models within the Splash Radius and LOS to the target location are targets. Models of equal or larger SIZ prevent models further away and along the LOF from becoming targets. When Attentive Ordered, this is their player’s choice. Have each target perform an Unopposed REF Test, and upon fail are subject to the effects of traits Traits. Reduce a target’s Armor traits [ AR ] by X for every Item.

Spotter X.description: Asset. When Enabled, allows its Controller to behave as a Spotter for Indirect Range Attacks from this model’s position. If the Controller also has this model within Cohesion, and has LOS to targets that are behind Cover, then this model: May check LOS to Reveal targets. May perform +X Modifier dice Detect Tests against targets that are behind Cover.

Spray.description: Attack Effect. When performing Range Hit Test ignore accuracy penalty for OR Multiples while Attentive or using a Concentrated Attack. Receive +1 Wild die Attacker Damage Test if target is at |Point-blank| range. A randomly selected model which 1 MU behind the target along LOF, or in base-contact to very first target of the attack, are also attacked if they within LOS.

Sprint X.description: Receives X × 4 MU for movement while moving in a relatively straight line.

Stealthy X.description: Psychology. Skill. See Night-vision X. See Sneaky X. May reposition an additional X × 1 MU immediately after losing Hidden status.

Stinger X.description: See [Stub]. See Impale. See Reach. This trait may be used to attack as though it were a Natural weapon. Receive Impact +X.

Strand X.description: Terrain. The Strand marker is 2 × X MU long by 0.5 MU wide. Each Strand marker assigned to a target causes a penalty of -1 MOV and -1 Defender Combat Tests. Models may remove Strand markers from base-contact, or assigned to themselves or to any model in base-contact by performing a Fiddle action using an Unopposed Physicality (higher of STR or SIZ) Test. Upon success remove one Strand from base-contact and move it out of base-contact up to cascades × 1 MU away. For every 3 successes, do this for an additional Strand marker. Models which start in base-contact with a Strand marker are considered as crossing Rough terrain for the first AP spent for Movement. At the end of the Turn, roll 2 Modifier dice for each group of Strands within 1-inch of each other. Failing to score a success removes a single Strand. Strand markers in base-contact with Fire markers are immediately removed.

Stream X > List.description: Attack Effect. Energy. Must target a battlefield location, and if it is not within LOS it may be targeted if there exists LOS to a midpoint above the battlefield between it and the Attacker. Place a reminder token to help visualize. Decide either to Saturate and target all models within X MU of location, or to Sweep and include all models within X MU of LOF of the location if at least ORM × 3 MU away. Reduce trait Traits by ORM to target from the Attacker. Apply trait effects to targets. Targeted characters may use Scramble! if qualified.

Strike.description: Receives +1 REF if in Wait status or when Attentive for Passive Player Options. Receive +1 Wild die Attacker Close Combat Hit Test if target is Distracted.

Structural.description: When targeted for a Defender Damge Test, unless the Attacker uses Concentrate reduces any Damage received by 1 per Impact. May not benefit from Recover, Revive. May not benefit from Medic or Heal unless this character also has the Regenerate trait.

Stun X.description: Attack Effect. If the Active character passes the Attacker Close Combat Damage Test, or if adding X causes the Test to pass, then there may be a Stun effect. Add X to the number of successes scored by the Active character, and subtract the target’s Durability, which is the higher of its SIZ or FOR. This is the Stun Test. Note these cascades. The target acquires a Delay token as Stun damage if the Stun Test passes, and one more for every 3 additional cascades.

Sturdy X.description: Reduces up to X Stun damage received of any attack. If the number of successes for the Damage Test is equal to or greater than this character’s SIZ, it will still receive a Stun damage.

Sub-form X.description: This archetype is a sub-form of a Multi-form list and should be paired with an appropriate model. Archetypes with Sub-form are disallowed to have the Multi-form trait. When this sub-form leaves In-Play with the possibility of returning this same Mission, remove a total of X Wounds, Fear, Poison, Burn, Delay, etc. status tokens.

Summon-bound > Summoner.description: When the summoner Summoner is KO'd or Eliminated, this model disappears at the end of its next Initiative, or the end of the next Turn whichever comes first. This model is always Linked to the Summoner, and while this model is In-Play, reduce the Summoner's POW by 1.

Supernatural X.description: Magic. If this trait is assigned to a character, it must use a Natural weapon to receive the benefit for Attacks. When Attacking, receives X Impact and X Pierce unless the target is able to use one or more of these keywords as the Defender; Magic or Energy. When Defending, ignores X Impact and X Pierce unless the attack has one or more of these keywords or traits; Magic, Fire, Energy, or Explosive. If Opposing models have the Supernatural trait, reduce X by the lower rating experienced by either model.

Surefooted X.description: Genetic. Movement. Upgrade Terrain effects on movement, and for Bonus Actions and Situational Test Modifiers. If X is 1 then Rough ¦ Clear. If X is 2 then Difficult ¦ Rough. If X is 3 then Difficult ¦ Clear.

Swarm X.description: Genetic. Receives X Go Points [ GP ] for every 2 Swarm members within Cohesion for its own Group Actions. There is no limit on the number of Group Followers if all have Swarm. May move across bases of any models without penalty. May use the Swap action at zero AP cost. Reduce any Wounds received by X unless they have the AoE, Fire, or Gas keyword. Prevents Opposing models in base-contact from using these Bonus Actions; Disengage and Push-back. All other Bonus Actions require +X cascades.

Switch:Trait.description: Asset. Begins as Disabled. May use a Fiddle action to toggle between Enabled or Disabled status. Any traits in list List when will become available when Enabled.

Synchronized X.description: Asset. Allows a Controller to |Sync| with its Automatons, making them a Sync’d Controller and Sync’d Automatons as a Sync’d pair. The Automatons must have the [Automaton+] trait. A Sync’d Controller always has LOS to any target if its Sync’d Automaton has LOS to that same target. At the start of its Initiative, the Controller may discard up to X Synch tokens it received. Each Initiative Point spent also removes a Synch token. An Enabled Sync’d Automaton during its Initiative may use up to X Levels of Skill traits of its Sync’d Controller within Cohesion. For each Action which does this, assign a Synch token to the Controller if one hasn’t already been assigned. When the Controller is paired with an Automaton with the [Automaton+] trait, it may use the higher of the Controller’s Attribute values [ CCA, RCA, REF, INT, POW ] or its own. For each Action which does this, assign a Synch token to the Controller if one hasn’t already been assigned.

Tactics X.description: Psychology. Skill. Leader. Receive +X Base dice when designated for Initiative Tests. Avoid the first additional turns requiring Situational Awareness. Requires Tactics Cards; When drawing Tactics cards, count the total Tactics trait level for all characters with the Tactics trait. Draw that many additional cards. (²) Requires Agenda Cards; When assigning Agenda cards, qualify to receive an additional card. (²)

Tall X.description: Genetic. May perform Fiddle actions against targets within X × 1 MU. Receive +X STR for when Throwing and increase Agility by X × 0.5 MU. At X being 1, 2, or 3; this model’s base-height is approximately 1.5×, 2.0×, and 3.0× its base-diameter.

Teeth&Nails X.description: See [Stub][2H]. See Cleave. Natural Weapon. Penalized -X Modifier dice for Close Combat Hit Tests, but receive +X Impact and +X Wild dice for the Attacker Close Combat Damage Test.

Telekinesis X.description: Cost 1 AP. If Attentive, move any weapon, model, or object within Visibility as though thrown or shove and thus subject to Falling & Collision Tests. Use OR equal to INT to reposition targets up to SIZ X +2 a maximum distance equal to INT × 1 MU. If the target is an Engaged character it is presumed to have successfully performed Disengage action.

Teleport X.description: Genetic. Magic. Skill. Virtuosity. Perform a Teleport action for 1 AP. Pick any location within 4 + 2X MU and reposition this model to there. Location must be within LOS of current position. If Attentive, spend a total of 2 AP instead and allow up to X models either Friendly or Distracted, which are in base-contact with the Teleporter, to reposition as well. These maintain their original relative positions at the new location. All characters which repositioned, except the Teleporter, receive 1 Delay token each. Remove up to X Delay tokens.

Tentacles X.description: Natural Weapon. See Multi-strike X. See [Hafted]. See Thresh.

Terrifying X.description: Attack Effect. Psychology. Magic. See Fear X. Opposing models which acquire one or more Fear tokens, will also acquire an equal number of Transfixed tokens. If Opposing models have the Terrifying trait, reduce X by the lower rating experienced by either model.

Tesseract X.description: Voluntarily leaves the battlefield for 1 AP as a Fiddle action, and will not count as being Eliminated. Each additional AP will allow one additional target which doesn't have a Magic trait and is in base-contact to come with if it is of no larger than SIZ + 3. All such targets are allowed a final action at -X Modifier dice Opposed INT Test before this model leaves with them. Upon pass, they acquire a Delay token. Upon fail, if they are Opposing models they count as Eliminated and are removed from play.

Thresh.description: Attack Effect. While Attentive and in base-contact to the Opposing model, negate the Coverage and Deflect traits of its Shield, Helm, or Gear armor types. Negate any Parry of target.

Throwable.description: Asset. see [Discard+]. Use as Thrown weapon for Ranged Attacks but do not receive any Accuracy [ Acc ] bonus.

Thrower X.description: Thrown weapons and weapons with the Throwable trait increase Maximum OR Multiple by X, and receives+ X Modifier dice for Attacker Range Combat Tests. For OR of the weapon, use Attacker's Physicality, the higher of its SIZ or STR.

Timing X.description: When Attentive, for any Opposed Test involving this character; for each Base die scored by the Opposing character showing a face-value of 1 , award that as a success for this character. Negates Timing X of opponent.

Toggle X.description: Intrinsic. Unless specified otherwise, begins any game session as Enabled. When Enabled it will receive the Initiative and behave as any other character. If Engaged, may be made Disabled! by an Opposing Attentive Ordered character in base-contact using a Fiddle action for X + 1 AP and pass a Fiddle Test DR 1. When Disabled!, will never receive the Initiative; identify with a Disabled! token as necessary If Free, may become Enabled by a Free Attentive Ordered character in base-contact using a Fiddle action for X AP, or Disabled! for X + 1 AP. If list List is provided; the first is the default status instead of Enabled. Performing a Fiddle action will cycle to the next status in List, and another Fiddle action will return to the first status. If trait list List is provided, each must be either assigned to a character or assigned to an Item it has before toggling status between Disabled! or Enabled. Missing one or more traits requires a Fiddle Test DR 1, with +1 AP and +1 DR per each.

Toggle X > List.description: Intrinsic. Unless specified otherwise, begins any game session as Enabled. When Enabled it will receive the Initiative and behave as any other character. If Engaged, may be made Disabled! by an Opposing Attentive Ordered character in base-contact using a Fiddle action for X + 1 AP and pass a Fiddle Test DR 1. When Disabled!, will never receive the Initiative; identify with a Disabled! token as necessary If Free, may become Enabled by a Free Attentive Ordered character in base-contact using a Fiddle action for X AP, or Disabled! for X + 1 AP. If list List is provided; the first is the default status instead of Enabled. Performing a Fiddle action will cycle to the next status in List, and another Fiddle action will return to the first status. If trait list List is provided, each must be either assigned to a character or assigned to an Item it has before toggling status between Disabled! or Enabled. Missing one or more traits requires a Fiddle Test DR 1, with +1 AP and +1 DR per each.

Torment X.description: Attack Effect. Psychology. Magic. If a Close Combat Attack causes the target to perform a Fear Test, acquire a Delay token to trigger this ability. When triggered, have the target to perform the Fear Test, but at DR X. For every miss, either assign to the target a Confused, Fear, Delay, or Transfixed token. If Opposing models have the Torment trait, reduce X by the lower rating experienced by either model.

Tough X.description: Intrinsic. May receive an additional +X Wounds as Light Wounds. X may not be higher than FOR.

Trample X.description: Natural Weapon. see Stun. When performing a Close Combat Attack, target up to X additional Opposing models SIZ -1 or smaller which are also in base-contact. Each additional target included causes -1 Modifier dice for the Close Combat Hit Test. For every SIZ larger than target receive +1 Impact and +1 Modifier die for the Attacker Close Combat Damage Test.

Transfix X.description: Attack Effect. AoE. Psychology. Psychic. Transfix range is X × 1 MU. Reduce X by 1 per MU beyond this model’s base-diameter. Once per Initiative, if Attentive Ordered, at the end of this model's Action, acquire a Delay token to trigger this ability. When triggered, all Opposing models which now become within Transfix range and LOS must perform an -X Modifier die Unopposed INT Test as a Transfix Test. Each miss assigns the target a Transfixed token. If Opposing models have the Transfix trait, reduce X by the lower rating experienced by either model.

Transform > Target.description: Replace target a model of choice

Transient.description: Magic. May identify self as in or not in Shadow status at the start of its Initiative. While in Shadow status;  May move through all models, obstacles, and terrain as Rough Terrain. Attacks by this characters and against this character , unless to a another Shadow status model, are disregarded unless they have one or more keywords; Explosion, Energy, Psychic, Magic, Psychology.

Translucent X.description: Visibility when targeted is always reduced by half; do this X times.

Trigger.description: See [Emplace]. When emplaced, assign a Friendly munitions to this trigger. This trigger may be displaced from that munitions any distance that can be reach via movement. During game-play, perform a Fiddle action to activate that munitions associated with this trigger.

Unarmed.description: The character temporarily has no weapons in hand, and has no Natural Weapons assigned to it. It may perform -1m Close Combat Hit Test, at STR -1m for the Close Combat Damage Test. Unarmed counts as having [Stub]. Unarmed characters may always acquire and use other weapons during game-play but then acquire [Discard] when using them and failing a Close Combat attack.

Unholy.description: See [Emplace]. When emplaced, assign a Friendly munitions to this trigger. This trigger may be displaced from that munitions any distance that can be reach via movement. During game-play, perform a Fiddle action to activate that munitions associated with this trigger.

Unit > Designation.description: Psychology. Mind. This character is one of many nearly identical Friendly Unit Members of a Unit named Designation. At the start of each Turn, a Side controlling Units receives no less than 1 Go Point per 2 Unit Members it has. Unit Cohesion is defined as being within LOS and no further than the distance of another model within the same Unit up to either model’s MOV × 1 MU. When Free, unless Attentive or Disordered, if this model is not within Unit Cohesion of a Friendly model of the same Unit it must, as its first Action, move to within Unit Cohesion of the nearest such model within LOS or if none, towards a Friendly battlefield edge. While Attentive, avoids an additional Turn for Situational Awareness.

Upgrade > Target.description: Upgrade: Type > Traits — Provides the traits Traits for Weapon, Armor, or Equipment of the type Type listed. The type may also refer to a trait, such as Reach or [Grenade X], that an Item should have.

War-cry X.description: Magic. Psychology. Skill. Pay 1 AP as a War Cry action and move into Melee Range against an Opposing character target within LOS. At the end of the Initiative, any Free Attentive Opposing characters within INT MU are subject to a Fear Test at -X Modifier dice. Compare X + SIZ to the SIZ of the target. If equal to or greater, the target must perform a Fear Test DR using the difference. If this character already has the Fear trait, add the level of that trait to the DR.

Ward X > List.description: Magic. Asset. Any Attacker Magic Tests against this character or target are at DR +X. When targeted by a Spell of the specialization Specialization, the Attacker requires X additional Mana.

Webcaster X.description: Webcast OR is X MU. Perform Range Combat Hit Test against an Opposing target model within X × 3 OR and LOF. Upon passing, place one Strand marker plus 1 per 3 cascades. The length of the Strand marker is 0.5 MU wide by 2 × X MU long. Do not penalize for each Webcast ORM. Instead reduce X one or more times to receive +1 Modifier dice each. If the Attacker Hit Test fails to place at least one Strand marker, place the Strand marker along the LOF at Webcast OR away beyond the target just before any terrain element. If this passes into or through any non-Webcaster model place the Strand marker in base-contact with that model however desired.

Webcrawler.description: May cross Strand markers and any terrain considered Webbing as Clear terrain, and may start climbing up or climbing down within the extent of any such terrain.

Whirling Death X.description: [Laden X] — Asset. Compare total 1 + X to Physicality which is the higher of this character’s SIZ and STR; for each above Physicality; Reduce MOV by 1 and any resultant Agility by half. Reduce traits by 1 if they improve Movement or Agility. Reduce REF by 1 unless Ordered Attentive or when on Wait status.

Windup X.description: Intrinsic. Magic. This model begins with 3X Windup tokens. For each Windup token spent up to X tokens at any time, receive one of the following; +1 Sprint or +1 STR or +1 Leap, or  +1 Wild die for Damage tests.

Wizard X.description: Spellcaster. At the start of each game receive INT Spells of choice; any spell may be taken multiple times. Also is assigned INT Spells at determined random; repeats increase their trait level each time. Discard the spell choice if it is higher than the Wizard level. See the Magic System rules for more information.

Zedsurge X.description: Genetic. Magic. At any time once per this character's Initiative, assign up to X Delay, Fear, or Wound tokens in any combination. For each assigned, receive +1 Mana.
